normalized: paying attention to our surroundings, we carefully goup to the second floor.
we find a large door past the stairway.

name: yuko
normalized: i'll have a little look so… stand back please.
yuko-sensei holds her hand up towards the door and chants.
we wait in silence for her to finish chanting.

name: yuko
normalized: there are no traps set here.
saying so, yuko-sensei grabs the doorknob and slowlyopens the door.
the inside of the room stinks of mold.
a vast, wooden room spreads out in front of us.
was this a salon or something?
sofas and tables and bookshelves… furniture whichprobably used to be very luxurious has been left behindto rot.
there are doors on the left and right walls.
the door onthe left is blocked by a crumbled bookshelf.
large pieces of lumber fallen from the ceiling hasblocked off the right door.
neither of other exitsin this room can be used.
the floor isn't in any better shape.
there are gapingholes here and there.
of course, there's no proper light in this room.
thedim, moldy room is full of dust.
the first one to notice something squirming in thedarkness was lily.
with a creepy sound, a presence approaches us.
there was no reaction from our opponent.

name: yuko
normalized: futaba-san, stay close to ichiro-kun please.
to protect me and lily, yuko-sensei stands between usand the presence.
around her, magic containing a thirst for blood startsto sway and shake.
just when i thought the creepy sound got louder――
the two of them dodge them just in the nick of time,but――
since my combat potential is zero, i'm unable to dodge.
the objects hit me in the head.

name: ichiro
normalized: oww… some… things just hit me!
the two shadows which jumped from within the darknesshit my head while passing by, whack whack.

name: nishida
normalized: teacher's witch of the ocean title isn't justfor show, either!
the two shapes now stand in a spot which has faintlight.
those shapes loudly laugh with familiar voices.
seeing their entirely different forms, i unintentionallyyelp in surprise.

name: lily
normalized: faust probably did this to them!
for some reason, as soon as the upperclassmen heardlily's words they suddenly got enraged.

name: ichiro
normalized: why did the upperclassmen get angry at you?

name: lily
normalized: there is no reason for some zombiethings to get angry at me!

name: lily
normalized: no matter how i look at you, you're zombies!

name: nishida
normalized: don't put us together with some lowlyzombies!

name: ichiro
normalized: zombies and ghouls huh… are they really any different?
i didn't understand what the upperclassmen were fuzzingabout.
maybe because the occult wasn't my strong point.

name: lily
normalized: well, who cares what you call it?
but, the upperclassmenare zombies, not ghouls.
the upperclassmen's anger reached a boiling point.
killing intent started to pour out of them.

name: ichiro
normalized: the upperclassmen are really angry, youknow!

name: lily
normalized: why should i apologize to zombies!
lily's behavior just added fuel into the upperclassmen'srage…
yuko-sensei's composed voice startles lily, but herexpression quickly stiffens.

name: lily
normalized: i thought of them as our upperclassmenand got caught off guard for a while there.

name: ichiro
normalized: y-yeah, that's right… they used to be our upperclassmenbut… those things aren't our upperclassmen anymore.
their sinister bloodlust is giving me goosebumps…

name: faust
normalized: it looks like mice have been caught in the mousetrap!
suddenly, a voice echoes in the room.
as yuko-sensei said, that voice seems to be coming fromthe upperclassmen.
the new voice belonged to that street vendor.
with that shout, the room starts to shake violently.
some regret could beseen on her face.
lily extends her hand towards me in the shaking room…
in order to grasp that hand, i also extend my hand…
the moment our fingers were about to meet――
with a thunderous roar, the floor collapses and the rooffalls down.
as everything comes down around me, i lose consciousness.
